fields.title: Classic Spaghetti Carbonara
fields.description: A traditional Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper. Simple ingredients create an incredibly rich and creamy sauce.
fields.ingredients:
400g spaghetti
200g pancetta or guanciale, diced
4 large eggs
100g Pecorino Romano cheese, grated
100g Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese, grated
Freshly ground black pepper
Salt for pasta water
fields.instructions:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions.
2. While pasta cooks, heat a large pan over medium heat and cook pancetta until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
3. In a bowl, whisk together eggs, both cheeses, and plenty of black pepper.
4. Reserve 1 cup of pasta cooking water before draining.
5. Add hot drained pasta to the pan with pancetta.
6. Remove from heat and quickly toss with egg mixture, adding pasta water gradually until creamy.
7. Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper.

fields.title: Thai Green Curry
fields.description: Aromatic and spicy Thai curry with tender chicken, vegetables, and fragrant herbs in rich coconut milk.
fields.ingredients:
500g chicken thigh, cut into pieces
400ml coconut milk
3 tbsp green curry paste
2 Thai eggplants, quartered
1 red bell pepper, sliced
100g green beans, trimmed
4 kaffir lime leaves
2 tbsp fish sauce
1 tbsp palm sugar
1/4 cup Thai basil leaves
Jasmine rice for serving
fields.instructions:
1. Heat 1/2 cup of the thickest coconut milk in a wok over medium-high heat.
2. Stir in curry paste and cook until fragrant, about 2 minutes.
3. Add chicken and cook until no longer pink, about 5 minutes.
4. Pour in remaining coconut milk, bring to a simmer.
5. Add eggplant, bell pepper, and green beans. Simmer 10 minutes.
6. Stir in fish sauce, palm sugar, and lime leaves.
7. Taste and adjust seasoning. Garnish with Thai basil.
8. Serve hot over jasmine rice.

fields.title: Perfect Chocolate Chip Cookies
fields.description: Crispy edges, chewy centers, and loaded with chocolate chips. The ultimate homemade cookie recipe.
fields.ingredients:
225g butter, softened
150g brown sugar
100g caster sugar
2 large eggs
1 tsp vanilla extract
300g plain flour
1 tsp baking soda
1 tsp salt
300g chocolate chips
100g chopped walnuts (optional)
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 180°C (160°C fan). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
2. Cream butter and both sugars until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
3. Beat in eggs one at a time, then vanilla extract.
4. In separate bowl, whisk flour, baking soda, and salt.
5. Gradually mix dry ingredients into wet ingredients until just combined.
6. Fold in chocolate chips and walnuts if using.
7. Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto prepared baking sheets, spacing 2 inches apart.
8. Bake 10-12 minutes until edges are golden but centers still soft.
9. Cool on baking sheet 5 minutes before transferring to wire rack.

fields.title: Beef Tacos with Homemade Salsa
fields.description: Juicy seasoned ground beef tacos topped with fresh homemade salsa, perfect for a quick weeknight dinner.
fields.ingredients:
500g ground beef
1 onion, diced
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tsp cumin
1 tsp chili powder
1/2 tsp paprika
Salt and pepper
8 taco shells
4 tomatoes, diced
1/2 red onion, finely diced
1 jalapeño, seeded and minced
1/4 cup cilantro, chopped
Juice of 2 limes
Shredded lettuce
Grated cheese
Sour cream
fields.instructions:
1. For salsa: combine diced tomatoes, red onion, jalapeño, cilantro, and lime juice. Season with salt and set aside.
2. Heat large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook ground beef, breaking it up with spoon, until browned.
3. Add diced onion and garlic, cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
4. Stir in cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook 2 more minutes.
5. Warm taco shells according to package directions.
6. Fill shells with beef mixture.
7. Top with fresh salsa, lettuce, cheese, and sour cream.
8. Serve immediately with lime wedges.

fields.title: Mediterranean Quinoa Salad
fields.description: Fresh and vibrant quinoa salad with cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, and feta cheese in a lemon herb dressing.
fields.ingredients:
200g quinoa
400ml vegetable stock
1 cucumber, diced
300g cherry tomatoes, halved
1/2 red onion, thinly sliced
100g Kalamata olives, pitted
150g feta cheese, crumbled
1/4 cup fresh parsley, chopped
2 tbsp fresh mint, chopped
3 tbsp olive oil
Juice of 2 lemons
1 tsp dried oregano
Salt and pepper to taste
fields.instructions:
1. Rinse quinoa under cold water until water runs clear.
2. Bring vegetable stock to boil, add quinoa, reduce heat and simmer covered for 15 minutes.
3. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes, then fluff with fork and cool completely.
4. In large bowl, combine cooled quinoa, cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, and olives.
5. In small bowl, whisk olive oil, lemon juice, oregano, salt, and pepper.
6. Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine.
7. Gently fold in feta cheese, parsley, and mint.
8. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes before serving.
9. Taste and adjust seasoning before serving.

fields.title: Japanese Chicken Teriyaki
fields.description: Tender chicken thighs glazed with sweet and savory homemade teriyaki sauce, served over steamed rice.
fields.ingredients:
8 chicken thighs, skin-on
1/4 cup soy sauce
2 tbsp mirin
2 tbsp sake (or dry white wine)
3 tbsp sugar
1 tbsp vegetable oil
2 green onions, sliced
1 tbsp sesame seeds
Steamed rice for serving
Steamed broccoli for serving
fields.instructions:
1. Pat chicken thighs dry and season with salt and pepper.
2. Heat vegetable oil in large skillet over medium-high heat.
3. Cook chicken skin-side down until golden and crispy, about 8 minutes.
4. Flip chicken and cook another 5 minutes until cooked through.
5. In small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, mirin, sake, and sugar.
6. Pour sauce over chicken in skillet.
7. Reduce heat to medium and simmer until sauce thickens and glazes chicken, about 3-4 minutes.
8. Remove from heat and sprinkle with green onions and sesame seeds.
9. Serve over steamed rice with steamed broccoli.

fields.title: Classic French Onion Soup
fields.description: Rich, caramelized onion soup topped with melted Gruyère cheese and crusty bread. A comforting French bistro classic.
fields.ingredients:
6 large yellow onions, thinly sliced
4 tbsp butter
2 tbsp olive oil
1 tsp sugar
1 tsp salt
3 tbsp plain flour
125ml dry white wine
1.5L beef stock
2 bay leaves
1/2 tsp fresh thyme
4 thick slices French bread
200g Gruyère cheese, grated
Freshly ground black pepper
fields.instructions:
1. Heat butter and olive oil in large heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat.
2. Add sliced onions, sugar, and salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 45-60 minutes until deep golden brown.
3. Sprinkle flour over onions and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes.
4. Add wine and scrape up any browned bits from bottom of pot.
5. Add beef stock, bay leaves, and thyme. Bring to boil, then simmer 20 minutes.
6. Season with salt and pepper. Remove bay leaves.
7. Preheat grill. Toast bread slices until golden.
8. Ladle soup into oven-proof bowls, top each with toast and generous amount of cheese.
9. Grill until cheese is bubbly and golden. Serve immediately.

fields.title: Indian Butter Chicken
fields.description: Creamy, mildly spiced tomato-based curry with tender chicken pieces. A popular Indian restaurant favorite made at home.
fields.ingredients:
1kg chicken breast, cut into chunks
200ml Greek yogurt
1 tbsp lemon juice
2 tsp garam masala
1 tsp cumin
1 tsp cayenne pepper
4 cloves garlic, minced
1 inch ginger, grated
2 tbsp butter
1 onion, diced
400g canned tomatoes
200ml heavy cream
1 tsp paprika
1/2 tsp turmeric
Fresh cilantro
Basmati rice for serving
Naan bread for serving
fields.instructions:
1. Marinate chicken in yogurt, lemon juice, 1 tsp garam masala, cumin, cayenne, half the garlic, and ginger for 30 minutes.
2. Heat butter in large pan over medium-high heat. Cook marinated chicken until done, about 8 minutes. Set aside.
3. In same pan, sauté onion until softened, about 5 minutes.
4. Add remaining garlic and ginger, cook 1 minute.
5. Add canned tomatoes, remaining garam masala, paprika, and turmeric. Simmer 15 minutes.
6. Blend sauce until smooth, return to pan.
7. Stir in cream and cooked chicken. Simmer 5 minutes.
8. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with cilantro.
9. Serve with basmati rice and naan bread.

fields.title: Homemade Margherita Pizza
fields.description: Classic Italian pizza with homemade dough, fresh tomato sauce, mozzarella, and basil. Simple perfection.
fields.ingredients:
For dough:
500g strong bread flour
325ml warm water
7g instant yeast
2 tsp salt
2 tbsp olive oil

For toppings:
400g canned San Marzano tomatoes
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tsp dried oregano
300g fresh mozzarella, torn
Fresh basil leaves
Extra virgin olive oil
Sea salt and black pepper
fields.instructions:
1. Mix flour, yeast, and salt in large bowl. Add water and olive oil, mix until rough dough forms.
2. Knead on floured surface for 10 minutes until smooth and elastic.
3. Place in oiled bowl, cover, and rise 1-2 hours until doubled.
4. For sauce: crush tomatoes by hand, mix with garlic, oregano, salt, and pepper.
5. Preheat oven to 250°C (230°C fan) with pizza stone or baking sheet inside.
6. Divide dough into 4 portions. Roll each very thin on floured surface.
7. Transfer to hot pizza stone, spread thin layer of sauce, add torn mozzarella.
8. Bake 10-12 minutes until crust is golden and cheese bubbly.
9. Remove from oven, immediately top with fresh basil and drizzle with olive oil.
10. Slice and serve hot.

fields.title: New York Style Cheesecake
fields.description: Rich, dense, and creamy cheesecake with a graham cracker crust. The ultimate American dessert classic.
fields.ingredients:
For crust:
200g graham crackers, crushed
80g butter, melted
50g sugar

For filling:
900g cream cheese, room temperature
200g caster sugar
3 large eggs
240ml sour cream
2 tsp vanilla extract
1 tbsp plain flour
Pinch of salt

For topping:
240ml sour cream
2 tbsp sugar
1 tsp vanilla extract
Fresh berries for serving
fields.instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 160°C (140°C fan). Grease 23cm springform pan.
2. Mix crushed graham crackers, melted butter, and sugar. Press into bottom of pan.
3. Beat cream cheese until smooth and fluffy, about 3 minutes.
4. Gradually add sugar, beating until combined.
5. Beat in eggs one at a time, then sour cream, vanilla, flour, and salt.
6. Pour over crust and smooth top.
7. Bake 50-60 minutes until center is almost set but still slightly jiggly.
8. For topping: mix sour cream, sugar, and vanilla. Spread over hot cheesecake.
9. Return to oven for 5 minutes.
10. Cool completely, then refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight.
11. Run knife around edge before removing from pan. Serve with fresh berries.
